name: CS50: Introduction to Computer Science
description: CS50 is Harvard University's introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming. It teaches students how to think algorithmically and solve problems efficiently.
summary: An entry-level course taught by Professor David Malan, covering topics like algorithms, data structures, and web development.

name: CS50's Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python
description: This course teaches the fundamentals of artificial intelligence, including search algorithms, knowledge representation, and machine learning, using Python.
summary: A comprehensive introduction to AI concepts and techniques, with hands‑on projects and real‑world applications.

name: Back Pain: Finding Solutions for Your Aching Back
description: This course provides insights into the sources of back pain and offers strategies to overcome and eliminate it.
summary: A practical guide to understanding and managing back pain, with expert advice from Harvard Health Publishing.

name: Abortion: Law, Policy and Ethics
description: This seminar explores the legal, policy, and ethical dimensions of abortion, examining historical and contemporary perspectives.
summary: An in‑depth analysis of abortion laws and policies, with discussions on ethical considerations and societal impacts.

name: Contract Law: From Trust to Promise to Contract
description: This course delves into the formation, enforcement, and breach of contracts, exploring the evolution of contract law.
summary: A comprehensive study of contract law, focusing on the principles that govern agreements and their enforcement.

name: Principles of Economics (Microeconomics)
description: This course covers the fundamentals of microeconomics, including market mechanisms, consumer behavior, and production theory.
summary: An introduction to microeconomic principles, providing a foundation for understanding economic decision‑making.

name: Principles of Economics (Macroeconomics)
description: This course introduces macroeconomic concepts, including national income, inflation, and monetary policy.
summary: A foundational course in macroeconomics, essential for understanding the broader economic environment.

name: Introductory Mechanics and Relativity
description: This course covers the principles of mechanics and the theory of relativity, providing a foundation for understanding physical phenomena.
summary: An introductory course in physics, focusing on classical mechanics and the special theory of relativity.

name: Introductory Electromagnetism
description: This course introduces the concepts of electromagnetism, including electric fields, magnetic fields, and electromagnetic waves.
summary: A foundational course in electromagnetism, essential for understanding modern physics and engineering.

name: Contract Law: From Trust to Promise to Contract
description: Explore how contracts are formed, what makes them enforceable, and what happens when one party breaks a promise.
summary: A foundational course in understanding the principles of contract law.

name: CS50: Introduction to Computer Science
description: An entry‑level course taught by David J. Malan, CS50x teaches students how to think algorithmically and solve problems efficiently.
summary: A comprehensive introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming.

name: CS50's Introduction to Programming with Python
description: An introduction to programming using Python, a popular language for general‑purpose programming, data science, web programming, and more.
summary: Learn the fundamentals of programming using Python.

name: 6-Week Plan For Healthy Eating
description: Overhaul your diet and nutrition with a simple, 6‑week plan assembled by Harvard experts.
summary: A structured plan to improve your eating habits.

name: Starting to Exercise
description: To address your physical fitness needs, you’ll want a mix of aerobic, strength training, and balance exercises. Learn how to create an effective workout plan in this special online course.
summary: A beginner's guide to starting an exercise routine.

name: American Government: Constitutional Foundations
description: Examine the inner workings of the three branches of the U.S. Federal Government.
summary: An in‑depth look at the U.S. Constitution and its application.

name: U.S. Political Institutions: Congress, Presidency, Courts, and Bureaucracy
description: Examine the inner workings of the three branches of the U.S. Federal Government.
summary: A comprehensive study of U.S. political institutions.

name: CS50 for Lawyers
description: This course is a variant of Harvard University's introduction to computer science, CS50, designed especially for lawyers (and law students).
summary: An introduction to computer science tailored for legal professionals.

name: Data Science: Machine Learning
description: Build a movie recommendation system and learn the science behind one of the most popular and successful data science techniques.
summary: Learn the fundamentals of machine learning through practical applications.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence
description: Explore cutting-edge AI techniques, including deep learning, NLP, and reinforcement learning, with applications in robotics and data science.
summary: A project-based course focusing on modern AI frameworks and ethical implications.

name: European Union Law
description: Study the legal framework of the EU, including treaties, competition law, and human rights legislation.
summary: Essential for aspiring lawyers and policymakers in the EU context.

name: Clinical Medicine Practicum
description: Hands-on training in diagnostics, patient care, and medical ethics at Bologna’s teaching hospitals.
summary: Integrates theory with clinical practice for medical students.

name: Renaissance Art History
description: Analyze masterpieces from Botticelli to Michelangelo, with visits to Bologna’s historic art collections.
summary: A journey through Italy’s artistic golden age.

name: Sustainable Agriculture
description: Learn eco-friendly farming techniques, food security strategies, and EU agricultural policies.
summary: Prepares leaders for the future of agro-industry.

name: Data Science for Business
description: Apply Python and R to solve real-world business problems using big data analytics.
summary: Blends technical skills with managerial insights.

name: International Human Rights Law
description: Examine global human rights frameworks, case studies, and advocacy strategies.
summary: Ideal for future NGO leaders and diplomats.

name: Pharmaceutical Biotechnology
description: Study drug development, biotherapeutics, and regulatory affairs in the EU market.
summary: Lab-intensive course for biotech innovators.

name: Medieval Literature
description: Dive into Dante’s Divine Comedy and other foundational texts of European literature.
summary: Explores the roots of Italian literary tradition.

name: Food Innovation & Policy
description: Analyze global food systems, sustainability challenges, and policy-making in the agri-food sector.
summary: Connects science, economics, and governance.

name: Robotics Engineering
description: Design and program autonomous systems using ROS (Robot Operating System) and AI integration.
summary: Hands-on robotics projects from prototypes to deployment.

name: Comparative Constitutional Law
description: Compare constitutional designs of Italy, the EU, and other democracies.
summary: Critical for legal scholars and public administrators.

name: Neuroscience Research Methods
description: Training in fMRI, EEG, and computational modeling for cognitive and clinical neuroscience.
summary: Prepares students for PhD-level research.

name: Digital Humanities
description: Apply computational tools to analyze historical texts, art, and cultural datasets.
summary: Bridges technology and the humanities.

name: Wine Economics
description: Study the global wine market, supply chains, and Italy’s role in viticulture innovation.
summary: Unique to Bologna’s Emilia-Romagna region.

name: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: Learn encryption, network defense, and ethical hacking techniques.
summary: Critical for IT professionals in the digital age.

name: International Trade Law
description: Cover WTO regulations, trade disputes, and cross-border contracts.
summary: Tailored for future corporate lawyers and trade negotiators.

name: Genomics and Precision Medicine
description: Explore CRISPR, personalized therapies, and bioinformatics tools.
summary: At the forefront of medical innovation.

name: Classical Archaeology
description: Excavation techniques and artifact analysis at Bologna’s archaeological sites.
summary: Fieldwork included in Roman and Etruscan ruins.

name: Organic Farming Certification
description: EU organic standards, certification processes, and sustainable practices.
summary: Prepares for careers in organic agribusiness.

name: Doctor of Medicine (MD)
description: A graduate-entry medical program combining clinical training with research. Includes placements at Royal Melbourne Hospital.
summary: Australia's #1 medical program (QS 2025), preparing leaders in healthcare.

name: Juris Doctor (JD)
description: Graduate law degree covering Australian and international legal systems. Pathways to bar certification.
summary: Ranked #10 globally (QS 2025), with moot court and industry placements.

name: Master of Engineering (AI)
description: Specialization in machine learning, robotics, and ethical AI development. Includes industry projects with Tesla and Atlassian.
summary: Accredited by Engineers Australia, with 94% employment rate.

name: Master of Finance
description: CFA-aligned program covering fintech, asset pricing, and global markets. Includes trading room simulations.
summary: Ranked #1 in Australia (THE 2025), with Bloomberg Terminal access.

name: Bachelor of Arts (Psychology)
description: Combines psychological science with humanities electives. Pathways to clinical or organizational psychology.
summary: APAC-accredited, with research labs and internship options.

name: Master of Biomedical Science
description: Research-focused program in genomics, neuroscience, or infectious diseases. Lab work at Peter Doherty Institute.
summary: Direct pathway to PhD, with 80% publication rate for students.

name: LLM in International Law
description: Focuses on UN frameworks, trade law, and human rights. Includes internships at ICC or WTO.
summary: Ranked #8 globally (QS 2025), with Geneva study tour.

name: Bachelor of Science (Computing)
description: Covers algorithms, cybersecurity, and quantum computing. Industry projects with CSIRO.
summary: ACS-accredited, with 92% graduate employment.

name: MBA (Executive)
description: Weekend/evening classes for professionals. Focus on Asia-Pacific business strategy.
summary: Ranked #1 in Australia (FT 2025), with consulting practicums.

name: Bachelor of Fine Arts (Film)
description: Hands-on training in directing, cinematography, and screenwriting at Melbourne's Victorian College of the Arts.
summary: Industry connections with Melbourne International Film Festival.

name: Master of Public Health
description: Covers epidemiology, health policy, and global health systems. Fieldwork in Indigenous communities.
summary: WHO-recognized, with placements at WHO or Australian Health Dept.

name: PhD in Criminology
description: Research-based program on policing, cybercrime, or restorative justice. Data partnerships with Victoria Police.
summary: Only program in Australia with a dedicated crime lab.

name: Master of Data Science
description: Advanced training in Python, ML, and big data tools like Hadoop. Capstone projects with ANZ or Telstra.
summary: ACS-accredited, with 96% employment rate.

name: Bachelor of Commerce (Accounting)
description: CPA/CA-accredited program with auditing, taxation, and blockchain accounting modules.
summary: Ranked #1 in Australia for accounting (QS 2025).

name: Master of International Relations
description: Analyzes global governance, diplomacy, and security threats. Internships at DFAT or UN agencies.
summary: Asia-Pacific focus, with optional Bahasa/Chinese language tracks.

name: Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS)
description: Clinical training at Melbourne Dental School, with community outreach programs.
summary: Ranked top 20 globally (QS 2025), with robotic surgery labs.

name: Graduate Diploma in Environmental Law
description: Covers climate change legislation, biodiversity treaties, and ESG compliance.
summary: Taught by former IPCC advisors, with fieldwork in Great Barrier Reef.

name: Bachelor of Design (Architecture)
description: Studio-based program with BIM training and sustainable design focus. Exchange options with ETH Zurich.
summary: Accredited by AACA, with 90% graduate employment.

name: Master of Management (Marketing)
description: Digital marketing, consumer analytics, and brand strategy. Projects with L'Oréal or Amazon.
summary: AMBA-accredited, with Google Analytics certification.

name: Bachelor of Music (Performance)
description: Classical/jazz training at Melbourne Conservatorium. Masterclasses with visiting artists.
summary: Ranked top 30 globally (QS 2025), with recording studio access.

name: Advanced Robotics Engineering
description: Covers humanoid robotics, swarm intelligence, and AI integration. Includes lab work at JSK Robotics Laboratory.
summary: Ranked #1 in Asia for robotics (QS 2025). Industry partnerships with Toyota and Sony.

name: Quantum Computing Theory
description: Advanced study of quantum algorithms and error correction. Research collaboration with RIKEN.
summary: Part of Todai's world-leading quantum research initiative.

name: International Business Law (LL.M.)
description: Focuses on Japan-EU trade agreements, corporate governance, and arbitration. Includes internships at METI.
summary: Taught by former WTO negotiators. Trilingual program.

name: Cancer Stem Cell Research
description: Cutting-edge techniques in oncology at Institute of Medical Science. Includes clinical observation at Todai Hospital.
summary: Linked to Japan's National Cancer Center research network.

name: Econometrics and Big Data
description: Advanced statistical modeling using Python/R. Case studies from BOJ and JP Morgan.
summary: Access to Nikkei database and Bloomberg terminals.

name: Space Systems Engineering
description: Satellite design and space mission planning. Collaboration with JAXA and NASA.
summary: Includes summer program at Tanegashima Space Center.

name: Neuroscience and AI
description: Interdisciplinary study of brain-inspired computing at RIKEN Center for Brain Science.
summary: Combines wet-lab experiments with machine learning.

name: Constitutional Law of Japan
description: In-depth analysis of Japan's postwar constitution, Article 9 debates, and judicial review.
summary: Taught by former Supreme Court clerks.

name: Regenerative Medicine
description: Stem cell therapies and organ regeneration research. Partnership with CiRA (Kyoto University).
summary: Includes GMP lab certification.

name: Behavioral Economics
description: Experimental approaches to market psychology. Fieldwork in Tokyo's financial district.
summary: Uses Todai's experimental economics lab.

name: AI for Social Implementation
description: Ethical AI deployment in healthcare and transportation. Projects with SoftBank and LINE.
summary: Focus on Japan's Society 5.0 initiative.

name: Particle Physics
description: KEK collaboration for neutrino and Higgs boson research. Includes summer school at CERN.
summary: Part of Todai's Nobel-winning physics tradition.

name: International Arbitration
description: Simulated arbitration cases under ICC and UNCITRAL rules. Moot court participation.
summary: Taught by former ICSID arbitrators.

name: Global Health Policy
description: Japan's healthcare system and pandemic response analysis. WHO-certified program.
summary: Includes fieldwork in aging communities.

name: Japanese Economic History
description: Postwar growth, bubble economy, and Abenomics analysis. Archives access to MITI documents.
summary: Unique focus on Japan's industrial policy.

name: Civil Infrastructure Resilience
description: Earthquake-resistant design and disaster prevention. Uses E-Defense shake table facilities.
summary: Developed standards for Japan's building codes.

name: Astrobiology
description: Origin of life research and exoplanet studies. Collaboration with NAOJ and NASA Astrobiology Institute.
summary: Includes fieldwork in extreme environments.

name: Comparative Corporate Law
description: Japan-US-EU corporate governance comparison. Case studies from Sony-Shark activist battle.
summary: Visits to Tokyo Stock Exchange.

name: Infectious Disease Epidemiology
description: Pandemic modeling and vaccine policy. COVID-19 response analysis with NIID.
summary: Includes biosafety level 3 lab training.

name: FinTech and Blockchain
description: Cryptocurrency regulation and decentralized finance. Partnerships with MUFG and SBI Holdings.
summary: Access to Japan's FinTech sandbox program.
